intro: Achyrocline saturejoides var. vargasiana, commonly known as the Vargasian chia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant is known for its aromatic leaves and small, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in high-altitude environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
